poem:
**The Stare**

Blank gaze, upon  
the world—silent  
as winter's first frost  
on the sill. Generation's  
unwritten verse,  
spilled out in  
unblinking prose.  
Behind counters,  
and unseen aisles,  
a mirror reflects  
youth's quiet  
knowing. Unnerved,  
we meet the void,  
where eyes speak  
what words cannot.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Have you been a victim of the ‘gen Z stare’? It’s got nothing on the gen X look of dread | Emma Beddington Have you been the victim of a gen Z stare? Maybe you have but didn’t realise, because you didn’t know it existed, so let me explain: gen Z, now aged 13 to 28, have apparently adopted a widely deplored stare: blank, expressionless and unnerving. The stare is often deployed in customer service". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Have you been a victim of the ‘gen Z stare’? It’s got nothing on the gen X look of dread | Emma Beddington Have you been the victim of a gen Z stare?
